profile.name: Rick Spence
profile.title: PROGRAM/PROJECT MANAGER
profile.description: Rick Spence is a highly accomplished and results-oriented Program/Project Manager with extensive experience in leading and delivering complex projects and programs within the Australian Defence Force and various government agencies.  His expertise spans end-to-end project management, risk mitigation, milestone achievement, and the management of diverse deliverables.  A highly organized and detail-oriented leader, Rick possesses exceptional communication and negotiation skills, effectively collaborating with internal teams, vendors, and stakeholders.  His proven ability to manage multiple teams, coordinate resources, and solve problems quickly ensures projects remain on track.  He is a forward-thinking professional with a strong commitment to achieving company goals and fostering team growth.  Rick's ambition and career focus make him an ideal candidate for challenging roles requiring strategic thinking and leadership.
profile.description2: With a strong background in Agile methodologies (SAFe, Scrum), Rick has consistently demonstrated his ability to implement and improve project management frameworks, leading to significant improvements in efficiency and delivery.  His experience includes coaching and mentoring teams in Agile practices, Jira administration, and the development of governance processes.  He has successfully managed projects involving substantial budgets and complex stakeholder relationships, consistently delivering exceptional results.  Rick's expertise in cloud computing (Microsoft Azure, AWS), cyber security, and digital transformation makes him well-suited for organizations seeking to modernize their operations and leverage cutting-edge technologies.  His commitment to continuous improvement and professional development, evidenced by his numerous certifications and memberships, ensures he remains at the forefront of industry best practices.

qualifications: IT Project Management, PMP PMBOK (Global Knowledge)
keyAchievements: Successfully implemented SAFe 6.0 for the DSE Program (JP9111, DEF2222, JP2181), optimizing Jira and Confluence and developing LACE Teams governance.
Created a chargeback system for Services Australia generating income from work done for DSS, NDIA, and DVA.
Successfully rescued a failing project for DSS, uplifting their network to PROTECTED, and achieving maturity level 2 in cyber security.

experience.title: Principal Consultant - Jigsaw Notions (PgO Business Transformation Team)
responsibilities: Served as RTE, Agile Coach, Scrum Master, and LACE member for Department of Defense programs.
Managed up to 9 teams comprising engineers, testers, developers, and cybersecurity professionals.
Mentored 6 project support officers/Scrum Masters.
Managed Jira boards and served as Jira client-side admin for multiple projects.

experience.title: Senior Strategic Project Manager - Department of Industry and Science (Cloud Platforms)
responsibilities: Identified improvements for the Microsoft Azure Cloud Platforms Team to transition into 2024.
Organized their DevOps environment, documenting all necessary data.
Built their first PowerBI dashboard and provided guidance to fellow cloud PMs.
Managed the "Tech Readiness" project for Microsoft Co-Pilot.

fullExperience.title: Principal Consultant - Jigsaw Notions (PgO Business Transformation Team)
responsibilities: Served as RTE, Agile Coach, Scrum Master, and LACE member for Department of Defense programs JP9111, DEF2222, and the PMO for the Digital Transformation program.
Managed up to 9 teams (engineers, testers, developers, technical writers, and cybersecurity teams).
Managed, supported, and mentored 6 project support officers/Scrum Masters.
Consulted on, created, and configured all Jira boards, acting as JP9111, DEF2222, and JP2181 Jira client-side admin.
Coached PSOs on becoming Scrum Masters and Scrum Masters on advancing their skills.
Coached team members (APS/ADF/Contractors) on PI/ART events, Agile ways of working, and Jira.
Worked with JP9111 & DEF2222 as the product manager.
Provided clarity, direction, and execution on DDG ways of working and Agile best practices for JP9111 and DEF2222.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Project Manager - Department of Industry and Science (Cloud Platforms)
responsibilities: Worked within the Microsoft Azure Cloud Platforms Team to identify improvements for 2024.
Organized their DevOps environment, ensuring all necessary data was documented.
Built their first PowerBI dashboard to display key DevOps information.
Provided guidance to fellow cloud PMs on projects, governance, and best practices.
Managed their "Tech Readiness" project for Microsoft Co-Pilot in conjunction with the DTA.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Project Manager - CSIRO
responsibilities: Served as Product Owner and project manager for Data Stewards and Software Coding projects, implementing data management practices and software coding frameworks within Microsoft Azure.
Leveraged digital library, cybersecurity, and training teams to conduct staff training on Data Stewardship and Software/Coding best practices.
Uplifted the cybersecurity maturity level within the projects.
Created CSIRO's first PM mentorship program.
Collaborated with CSIRO executives on building their PMO.

fullExperience.title: Senior Consultant - Jacobs Australia (DDG, Department of Defense)
responsibilities: Analyzed a backlog of over 120 projects as part of the PMO, assessing in-flight projects against the gates process and reporting recommendations.
Worked with the executive team to hire 3 PMs, BAs, and engineers.
Structured the program and developed the budget for board approval.
Created a SAFe methodology framework tailored for the department.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Program Manager - Department of Defense (SOMIIC)
responsibilities: Re-established alignment within the SOMIIC team and stakeholder connections.
Built and delivered a project/portfolio framework.
Managed initiatives with budgets up to billions of dollars across the Australian Defence Force.
Managed the build-out of ServiceNow aligned with the SAFe model.

fullExperience.title: Senior Strategic Program Manager - The Architecture Practice (TAP) (Department of Defense, Dept. Aged Care)
responsibilities: Collaborated with TAP ICT solution architects and partners (Infosys, Manpower, software vendors) to interview stakeholders.
Provided analysis and recommendations for necessary work and a roadmap within Microsoft Azure.
Guided the Defense cyber team through their iRAP process.
Shaped the scheduling and financial aspects of the ADF recompete bid (valued at 2.1 billion).

fullExperience.title: Senior Consultant - Projects Assured (Services Australia, NDIA, DSS, DVA)
responsibilities: Created a Digital Transformation and Data Management program of work, comprising 6 internal work streams, 4 agencies, and various contractors and vendors in Microsoft Azure.
Created a chargeback system for Services Australia, generating revenue from work done for DSS, NDIA, and DVA.
Successfully delivered a project for DSS, uplifting their network to PROTECTED.
Managed the cyber team to achieve maturity level 2 and developed a future roadmap.

fullExperience.title: Senior Consultant - Veritec (CDPP, The AEC, The Nine Network)
responsibilities: Managed the upgrade of CDPP's Mobile Device Management system and network uplift to PROTECTED.
Served as a member of the PMO.
Managed the Nine Network's digital transformation project from Google to Microsoft Azure.

fullExperience.title: Program Director - Diversity Array Technologies (DArT) (CIMMYT Mexico, Internal company)
responsibilities: Assessed, recommended changes, and executed plans, while hiring additional staff and managing a major client as the product owner.
Structured projects, resources, and budgeting, working with major clients.
Trained DArT staff and CIMMYT (Mexico) on Scrum Agile and implemented best practices for software development in AWS.
Served as the direct customer-facing delivery manager for CIMMYT, visiting Mexico for on-site work.
Managed framework improvements and updates to service integration and management systems.

fullExperience.title: Program Director - American Driveline (AAMCO)
responsibilities: Program managed the company's largest modernization program, improving its financial status.
Built teams that delivered a Digital Modernization and Data Management program in Microsoft Azure for 750 franchisees.
Traveled extensively throughout the US and Canada, training franchisees.
Created a CRM dashboard providing data on job pricing, parts costs, and revenue information for franchisees.
